result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin L Hobbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Defendant is NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 

Sentence credit of 189 days is granted.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence currently being served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of extended supervision. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Obtain/Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. 
No contact with victims or their residence.
No use or possession of weapons. 
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

03:01 PM Defendant Calvin L Hobbs in court, in custody, with attorney Patrick Flanagan.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Victims appear in person.
State places offer on the record.
State has filed a 2nd Amended Complaint.
Court conducts plea colloquy.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 with the repeater struck.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Count 2 is Dismissed and read in.
Case 22FO185 is Dismissed and read in.

State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Victims A & B make statements to the court.
Defendant makes statement to the court.

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:

15   YEARS OF IMPRISONMENT (Credit: 189 Days)
5   YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
10    YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
Consecutive to:  any other sentence currently being served; 

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*Absolute Sobriety; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*Obtain/Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling;
*No contact with:  victims or their residence; 
*No use of social media applications; 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done;
*No use or possession of weapons (e.g. knives, firearms, etc.);

RESTITUTION:  $0;
COSTS:  $268     
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250     
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
**To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 8/03/22

records.addlTxt:
Request for Substitution against Judge Laura Lau, received on today's date. Filed by Atty Wolff.
  ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 02-07-22.** Request granted

11:26 AM Defendant Calvin L Hobbs in court, in custody, with attorney Peter M Wolff.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

The State sequesters its witnesses. 

Detective Natalie Johnston, of the City of Muskego Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Will.
Cross examination by attorney Wolff.
Redirect by ADA Will.
The witness is excused.
Detective Timothy Sullivan, of the City of Muskego Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Will.
Cross examination by attorney Wolff.
The witness is excused.
The State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
The Court places its findings on the record.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.

THE DEFENDANT ENTERS A DEMAND FOR SPEEDY TRIAL.
Motion and Order To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Lau.
Status conference on February 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on February 7, 2022 at 10:15 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A (including his residence)/Larry B./co-defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 5 miles of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.
